info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued July 07 at 2:15PM CDT until July 08 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT... ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 PM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Excessive Heat Warning, dangerously hot conditions with heat index values of 100 to 106. For the Heat Advisory, heat index values up to 105 expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Kansas and central, east central, southwest and west central Missouri. * WHEN...For the Excessive Heat Warning, until midnight CDT tonight. For the Heat Advisory, from midnight tonight to 9 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
